Job Description
About the Client
Our client is a well established Hong Kong company who leads the industry in digital innovation and new technology (IOT) installation. The company has an enviable record of success and they are now further expanding their business extensions in Hong Kong & Greater Bay Area. To maximise capacity and identify growth opportunities for the future, an experienced professional is sought to fill the position of a Director, AI Research - Data Scientist.

About the Role
Reporting to the CIO, you will build data-science and technology based algorithmic solutions to address business needs. You will anticipate and evaluate impact of analytical solutions on related projects as part of the developing complex analytical algorithm/solutions for various business problems. In addition, you need to discover new research problems, develop novel models, design careful experiments and generally advance the state of the art in AI. Lastly, you need to focus on methods that can learn multiple layers of rich, non-linear feature extractors and can scale to large amounts of data

The Successful Applicant
PhD in Computer Science, related technical field or equivalent practical experience.
Experienced in data analysis, data mining, mathematical modelling and programming, statistical analysis, forecasting/predictive modelling, simulations, optimisation, visualisations, machine learning, etc
Demonstrated ability to work with ambiguous problem definitions, recognise dependencies and deliver high impact solutions through logical problem solving and technical ideations Ability to learn new analytical methods and technologies and apply in practical business problems
Good interpersonal, problem solving, reasoning and analytical skills
Demonstrated problem solving and decision-making skill
Hands-on experience with Software and/or Algorithm development
Software engineering background including requirements, design, development, integration and testing
Experience with Algorithms utilising Deep Learning and/or Image/Signal Processing
Good command in English and Chinese

Due to the current situation related to the Novel Coronavirus (2019-nCoV), we’re leveraging our digital capabilities to ensure we can continue to recruit top talent at HSBC. If so, one of our Resourcing colleagues will explain how our video-interviewing technology will be used throughout the recruitment process and will be on hand to answer any questions you might have.
Some careers grow faster than others.

If you're looking for a career that will give you plenty of opportunities to develop, join HSBC and your future will be rich with potential. Whether you want a career that could take you to the top, or simply take you in an exciting new direction, HSBC offers opportunities, support and rewards that will take you further.

Compliance is a global function that brings together all aspects of regulatory and financial crime risk management. Acting as risk stewards, and incorporating a range of specialist teams, we work together with the business and leverage advanced technology to help HSBC navigate a complex regulatory landscape and embed a sustainable approach to compliance risk management that supports safe growth and serves customers fairly. Compliance aspires to continuously raise the bar and set leading standards across the industry to help HSBC safeguard its customers and the communities within which it operates.

We are currently seeking a high calibre professional to join our team as Surveillance Manager.
Principal responsibilities
This is a project manager / business analyst role working within the ASP FCTM Surveillance Product Management and Transformation team.
Responsible for the ASP aspects, in particular China, of the global implementation programme for rolling out new surveillance solutions and demising legacy systems.
The role will concentration on one of two areas: Communications Surveillance or Trade Surveillance.
Investigate and document the business requirements and data sharing restrictions for China instance of global systems.
Manage the implementation of significant technology deliverables in China.
Work throughout the project lifecycle (from conception to implementation), across the three pillars of people, process and technology. Partner with global GBM stakeholders across front office, surveillance and compliance, technology teams and other functions.
Manage the implementation of significant technology deliverables, across borders.
Foster a close relationship with key front office and support function stakeholders across multiple legal entities.
Assisting team members with the implementation and roll-out of a new surveillance tools and models.
User Acceptance Testing (UAT) of new automated surveillance tests. Providing detailed analysis and test scripts.
Support FCTM Surveillance BAU activities as needed.
Qualifications
Requirements
Knowledge of the current state of surveillance technology would be a distinct advantage, particularly experience with these systems:
Communications Surveillance: CSURV from Digital Reasoning, Orchestria from CA.
Trade Surveillance: TradingHub, Actimize, Redkite, Odessey.
Solid project management / business analysis skills, preferably within a finance industry organisation, ideally within a Compliance function.
Experience with trading systems data and resolving data quality problems would be an advantage.
Educated to degree level. Strong report writing skills.
Compliance monitoring experience and expertise would be an advantage.
A sound understanding of local regulation particularly in relation to the rules relevant to trading and sales activities would be an advantage.
Knowledge of local market abuse regulation and overseas regulations would be an advantage.
Sound knowledge of Global Banking and Markets desirable.
Knowledge of China data sharing restrictions and approaches to compliance desirable.
Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to communicate effectively with both Compliance and Business Management.
Ability to handle escalated issues and take these forward with Senior Management.
Chinese language spoken and written to business level would be an advantage.
Sound Product Control background / awareness would be an advantage.
Ability to use technological resources available for surveillance activities.
Candidates with less experience can be considered as Manager (GCB5).

You'll achieve more when you join HSBC.

Clover is reinventing health insurance by working to keep people healthier.We value diversity — in backgrounds and in experiences. Healthcare is a universal concern, and we need people from all backgrounds and swaths of life to help build the future of healthcare. Clover's engineering team is empathetic, caring, and supportive. We are deliberate and self-reflective about the kind of engineering team and culture that we are building, seeking engineers that are not only strong in their own aptitudes but care deeply about supporting each other's growth.We are looking for software engineers that want to solve many different kinds of problems. You will work with other engineers, data scientists, and healthcare professionals building tools to improve the health of real people.As a Software Engineer, you will: Commit to simplifying the complexities of healthcare by building systems that multiply human efforts.Learn about new tools and technologies to solve problems and move our goals forward.Help the team define and maintain development practices that let us iterate quickly while maintaining quality — including writing tests and documenting key implementations.Work with Product Managers and operational staff to conceptualize new features.You will love this job if: You are excited by big, complicated problems and try to solve them with pragmatic, well-engineered solutions. You have a natural intellectual curiositythat drives you to find out how things work and if they can work better.You enjoy working in a fluid, collaborativeenvironment, defining and owning priorities that adapt to our larger goals. You can bring clarity to ambiguity while remaining open-minded to new information that might change your mind.You are not hesitantto jump in to help fix things that are broken and you feel great responsibility to make sustainable systems. You are happy to fill in the gaps to reach a goal where necessary, even if it does not always fit your job description.You have a genuineinterest in what good technology can do to help people and have a positive attitude about tackling hard problems in an important industry.You should get in touch if: You have experience with functional or imperative programming languages -- e.g., Python, Ruby, Go, C, or Java.You approach building and maintaining systems with maturity and rigor.You are able to work in different technical systems and concerns.You have both built and refactored complex (often distributed) systems.Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records. We are an E-Verify company.About Clover: We are reinventing health insurance by combining the power of data with human empathy to keep our members healthier. We believe the healthcare system is broken, so we've created custom software and analytics to empower our clinical staff to intervene and provide personalized care to the people who need it most.We always put our members first, and our success as a team is measured by the quality of life of the people we serve. Those who work at Clover are passionate and mission-driven individuals with diverse areas of expertise, working together to solve the most complicated problem in the world: healthcare.From Clover’s inception, Diversity & Inclusion have always been key to our success. We are an Equal Opportunity Employer and our employees are people with different strengths, experiences and backgrounds, who share a passion for improving people's lives. Diversity not only includes race and gender identity, but also age, disability status, veteran status, sexual orientation, religion and many other parts of one’s identity. All of our employee’s points of view are key to our success, and inclusion is everyone's responsibility.Job Type: Full-timeLocation:Hong Kong (Preferred)

Job title: APAC | Hong Kong | Global Transaction Services | Full Time Analyst 2020
Job description:
Our Business
Global Transaction Services (GTS) is a core business for Bank of America Merrill Lynch’s global franchise. The GTS team provides global working capital solutions including liquidity management, payments and receipts, trade and supply chain finance, foreign exchange and commercial card services to multinational corporations, financial institutions and governments around the world.
Since 1947 Bank of America Merrill Lynch has been offering working capital solutions in Asia Pacific tailored to meet the growing needs of our clients with diverse geographic presence.
GTS Analysts work with experienced professionals to deliver the breadth of GTS solutions and services to our clients based in the Asia Pacific region

Overview
The Global Transaction Services Analyst Program is an 18 month in-country rotational program designed to provide Analysts with an opportunity to work alongside an experienced GTS team to prepare for a career in GTS. Rotations will allow you to experience and directly support the GTS business. You will work closely with sales teams who cover clients from Corporates and Financial Institutions and product teams who cover payments & receipts, liquidity management, FX, commercial card and trade products. Upon completion of the program, you will be placed into one of these teams on a permanent basis.
As an Analyst you will shadow GTS professionals, or work independently taking ownership of key projects to to support strategic business initiatives. Likewise there will be an expectation that Analysts will use their own initiatives and explore ideas to add value to the GTS business.

Responsibilities (vary with each rotation)Take ownership of rotation projects, understand the requirements of the project and practice time management, project planning and execution skills to complete your project within the timeframe of your rotationProactively network internally to learn more about the business as well as report back on business initiatives worked on throughout your rotationsTake the opportunities presented to learn more about other lines of businesses in Asia PacificIntegrate as a team member during your rotations and communicate with the team on project milestonesConduct comprehensive and in-depth company and industry researchConduct analysis and manage reporting and trackingCreate various internal documents, materials, reports and data inventories as requiredPrepare presentations and other materials to support delivery of proposals and pitches to clients/ prospective clients to drive new businessPlay an active part in organizing and attending client meetings and events to learn more about client activity, following up on any action points where requiredSupport the team to solve client needs and generate revenue for the bankLearn from, and work with, teams across the business, including senior managers within your group, experts in other areas of the firm and colleagues from around the globe

Training
For most countries in Asia Pacific, training begins when you join newly-hired analysts from around the world for an intensive few weeks in New York. Here you will have the opportunity to network and to learn about our company and its culture. You will be trained on all the relevant tools, techniques and working practices as well as professional skills and team-working capabilities needed to succeed in the GTS Analyst Program.
On return to your local office, you will start your first rotation in GTS given responsibilities immediately and will be expected to make a significant contribution to the team. As internships mirror full-time positions, they also include goal-setting and a formal review process as well as plenty of opportunity to interact and work with senior managers.
The program has been carefully structured to ensure exposure to all areas of the GTS business. A challenging program with the right support model in place to ensure coaching and support allowing you to succeed in your rotations as well as your self-development, growing your abilities through on-the-job learning, preparing you for your permanent placement in the GTS business. The emphasis is on guidance and support for each individual, to promote independence and professional growth and cultivate the unique value that you will bring to impact the GTS business. We’ll support and reward you on the basis of your individual performance.
Following the formal training program, you will be onboarded to the Global Banking and Markets Analyst & Associate Academy (GBAM AAA), which will take you on a journey through our global curriculum.

QualificationsFinal year undergraduate/master studentOutstanding academic achievement

Required Skills and AbilitiesStrong quantitative and analytical skillsEffective verbal and written communicationComfortable with change and adjust to changing demands and requirementsA strong team player and client focusDemonstrates energy and initiativePositive approach and open to learning new skillsCreative thinking and problem-solving skillsDemonstrates a keen interest in the business Fluency in English is essential, appropriate Asian language skills are also essential for some roles and countries

Job title: IT Business Analyst / Vice President - System Planning & Coordination Team
Job description:
Company Overview Mizuho Bank, Limited has a long-term commitment to the Hong Kong market. With a strong global connection and a workforce of over 600 staff in Hong Kong, Mizuho Bank, Limited, is able to help corporations in Hong Kong to expand their business worldwide. Our clients comprise Japanese and non-Japanese corporations including PRC related ones, financial institutions, government and quasi-government organizations, etc. We provide a full spectrum of corporate banking services to our customers including syndication loans, treasury, transaction banking, financial advisory, project finance, merger and acquisition, leveraged finance, structured finance, etc. Why Mizuho At Mizuho, we provide the stability of an international industry leader with the career trajectory of a growing business. Our steady, strategic growth gives our people at all levels rewarding degrees of responsibility and a richer work experience than a boutique firm or an established giant could offer alone. It’s the local expertise of our employees that makes our global network so powerful. By collaborating with colleagues and clients who have your same ambition and drive, you can amplify your sphere of influence and base of knowledge as part of one of the largest—and growing—banks in the world. About the Team The Systems Planning and Coordination Team is part of the Systems Planning and Development Section (SPD). SPD is responsible for overall system planning of Hong Kong office, EUC/RPA development, PoC for new system solution, and security control. System Planning and Coordination Team is mainly responsible for system planning and coordination with users for requirement gathering of system developments, UAT support and inquiry/trouble shooting, and also acting as a window to our Head Office in Tokyo and other related department for any system related matters. Role requirements To gather business requirements to perform analysis and handle documentation; To bridge business ends and IT teams in order to ensure business requirements well address business needs and validate technical solutions for fulfilling business needs; To breakdown a business process workflow into user stories; To drive and manage user testing exercises including User Acceptance Test (UAT) preparation (e.g. designing test scenarios, test plans and test cases) and perform pre-UAT quality check cycles; To develop and manage Project Management Plan for revamping current EUC systems; To coach and educate project members to uplift the effectiveness of project delivery. Essential Functions To act as a senior IT business analyst or project coordinator role to support the improvement of operational efficiency of the Bank; To develop and manage project plans to support revamping existing EUC systems in a way to catch up with changing markers and latest financial technologies; To understand user requirements to support the development of effective IT solutions for the Bank. Competencies We are looking for an individual who is able to proactively initiate changes and improvements for higher productivity/performance; The individual should be able to propose team strategies and practical action plans for the Team/Section; Nurtures the performance and potential of juniors by providing regular feedback/guidance. Work experience, education and skills Bachelor’s degree, preferably IT related discipline; 5 years' experience in business analysis with project management exposure in banking industry; Experience in business analysis with project management exposure for big and long-term IT projects in banking industry; Experience or sound knowledge in SWIFT, RTGS, FPS and/or Remittance and Trade services are highly preferred; Professional certification in Business Analyst and/or project management (PMP, PRINCE2, COBIT, ITIL, etc.) is preferable; Experience on systems analysis, programming and report development (Excel or Business Intelligence tools); Fluent English and Cantonese is required; Japanese speaking is a bonus; Good communication, analytical, presentation and negotiation skills; Good working attitude with adequate interpersonal skills; Ability to work independently in highly-pressured and timeline-driven environment; Familiar with Microsoft products. Application Please indicate yourcurrent salary, expected salary and notice period on the CV for the application. Mizuho Bank, Limited Mizuho Bank Limitedis an integral part of the Japan-based Mizuho Financial Group, Inc. (NYSE: MFG). The Mizuho group is a global financial services leader with offices in nearly 40 countries, approximately 60,000 employees, and assets of more than USD 1.8 trillion. Mizuho provides expertise in retail banking, corporate finance, investment banking, asset management, capital markets, and sales and trading, to help businesses develop and find new opportunities for growth. To learn more: www.mizuho-fg.com Personal data collected will be kept in strict confidence, and will be used for recruitment purpose only.

Hadoop, Spark, Kafka,

Relational SQL and NoSQL databases

Job Description
About the Client

Our client is a conglormorate. To cope with their business needs, they are inviting a Assistant Manager join their IT team in Hong Kong.
About the Role

The Successful ApplicantDegree qualification in Information Technology or related disciplines.Minimum 6 years of experience in application & system development and minimum 2 years of experience as System Analyst or similar capacity.Minimum 3 years of hands-on experience in Enterprise Directory Architecture and Azure/O365 infrastructure (e.g. Microsoft Active Directory, LDAP, Azure AD and Azure Identity/Federation services).Solid experience in design, development, implementation and support of enterprise-level applications.Experienced in using Weblogic, TOMCAT, Java, JSP, JavaScript, HTML, CSS, PHP, XML and PL/SQL.Experienced in supporting Office applications (e.g. MS Office 2016, SharePoint, Skype/Teams and Office 365) in different operating systems (i.e. Windows, Linux and Mac OS, Android and IOS).Knowledgeable on Microsoft Windows Servers, virtualization and network technologies preferably in Hyper-V and VMware.Experience in infrastructure components, switching, routing, load balancing and firewall technologies will be an advantage.Experience in relational database design/development in Oracle, Microsoft SQL and MySql will be an advantage.Highly motivated self-starter as well as a team player who takes initiative with minimal supervision.Customer-focused with strong system analysis and problem-solving skill.Excellent communication skills in both written & verbal English and Chinese.

For our Hong Kong office, we are currently recruiting for all levels of Managers, from Associate Managers, Managers and Senior Managers in our Consumer Insights team.
About the Consumer Insights Team:
Companies have increasingly been relying on market insights to make informed decisions and our role at Nielsen has evolved into us being information scientists - predicting the ‘What's Next’ for our clients, in order for them to grow, stay relevant in the present and for the future. Our behavioral researchers in Nielsen’s Consumer Insights team tackle our clients’ issues by unlocking the why and the how, while our data researchers identify key clients' priorities quantitatively by applying data science techniques on survey and other big data sources.
About the Role:
The role of a Manager is fundamental to the success of the business. In this capacity, the CI Manager works with internal teams across the organization from team members in the Commercial side of the business as well as Operations and Statisticians to design, manage and execute a wide variety of measurement and insight projects. The CI Manager plays an important client-facing role, helping to support Directors when engaging with clients to understand what they truly want before designing custom solutions to meet their needs across a wide range of data and research needs: consumer insight and understanding, brand and marketing strategy, media measurement and analytics, customer experience and product testing and design.
Key Tasks and Responsibilities:
Provide operational support to the Research Director on a vast array of activities such as proposal preparation, questionnaire development, fieldwork management and data quality, as well as to help formulate and prepare client reports.
Assist in project management to ensure research projects are managed effectively and efficiently.
Assist in client servicing to ensure day-to-day project tasks are executed in an accurate and timely manner.
Actively participate in data analysis and insight generation to provide high quality and actionable solutions for our client work across different industries such as Banking and Finance, Public Enterprises, Luxury, hospitality, apparel, sports, property and Tech & Telco.
Manage a team of Analysts and Senior Analysts, developing your teambuilding skills.
Participate in learning and development forums to help upskill your own knowledge so that you can interface with clients to explore their needs and propose the newest and most relevant solutions.

Experience:
University graduate in any faculties. Marketing, Business, Social Sciences, Mathematics, Statistics or equivalent preferred.
Two years or more research working experience will be preferred.
Strong client services and communication skills and detail-oriented with strong analytical skills
A strategic thinker looking to put together data and research findings with business and marketing strategy
Strong coordination and time management skills
Proactive and striving for excellence, who can work independently and within a team
Good command of oral and written English and Cantonese. Mandarin is a plus.

Kindly note that our recruiter is based in Malaysia, so please pay attention to call number with (+603) for the interview arrangement.
To find out more about what it's like to work with Nielsen and how we can help you fulfill your career aspirations, please visit our website http://www.nielsen.com/hk/en/about-us/careers.html and send email to: jobs@nielsen.com

KaiOS Technologies powers an ecosystem of affordable digital products and services. Its flagship product, KaiOS, is the emerging mobile operating system for smart feature phones with more than 50 million active users in over 100 countries. KaiOS is based on HTML5 and other open web technologies. Devices running on the platform require limited memory, while still offering a rich user experience through access to apps like the Google Assistant, WhatsApp, YouTube, Facebook, Google Maps, and Twitter.

Kais mission is to help close the digital divide by bringing mobile connectivity to the billions of people without internet in emerging markets, as well as providing those in established markets with an alternative to smartphones. To make this happen, Kai partners with leading ODM/OEMs and carriers, such as ATT, Sprint, T-Mobile, Reliance Jio, Orange, MTN, China Mobile, HMD, Doro, and Bullitt. Kai is also backed by major technology and telecom industry players, including Google and Reliance Jio. Together with these partners, Kai focuses on creating affordable devices and data plans that make internet access a reality for everyone, while simultaneously helping partners transform their business models.

Job Highlights

Minimum 7 years of industry experience

Understanding of digital mobile business

Extensive programming experience

Job title: Assistant Technical Analyst - Machine Learning Engineer
Job description:
We are a leading international container transport and logistics service provider, operating from more than 360 offices in 70 countries around the world. Our modern and ever-expanding fleet, in addition to our extensive international facilities, links Asia, Europe, North America and Mediterranean, the Indian sub-continent, the Middle East and Australia/New Zealand. As a customer-focused organization we embrace quality standards, utilizing the most advanced information technology and e-Commerce platforms in the industry.

OOCL has long been recognized as the industry leader in developing and providing IT solutions for both container transportation customers and logistics customers. In addition, we are also the pioneer in the provision of IT solutions for other industry players through our advanced systems and portals. One such system is CargoSmart, one of the most advanced online application and integration service in the ocean container transportation industry, which has received 5 awards for its innovative use of leading technology.

At OOCL we recognize that people are our most important asset and would like to invite high-caliber candidates to join our global team.

This position will partner with Data Scientists and Data Engineers to operationalize models and deliver insights to the business.

Design, implement, validate and administer the distributed training platforms for machine learning

Automate model training, testing and deployment via commercial or open-source tools where appropriate

Research and implement best practices to improve the existing machine learning infrastructure

Optimize solutions for performance and scalability

Validate the training datasets provided by Data Engineers

Implement simulation environment for reinforcement learning and develop regression test cases to ensure its correctness and quality

Requirements

Bachelors degree in computer science (or in a highly related area) or equivalent practical experience

Goodscripting and programming skills in at least one object-oriented programming language, e.g. Python, Java, Scala. Experience with Rust is a plus.

Familiarity with machine learning fundamentals and libraries, e.g. pandas, NumPy, SciPy, PyTorch, TensorFlow, LightGBM, etc

Experience with SQL and any RDBMS, e.g. Oracle 12c

Familiarity with application container concepts, e.g. Docker

Understand and use computer science fundamentals, including data structures, algorithms, complexity and computer architecture

Familiarity with Linux systems and command-line interfaces, e.g. bash

Passion for solving software engineering problems

Willingness to collaborate and communicate with others to solve a problem

Self-learner with the ability to pick up new technologies, new tools and provide tangible results

Understanding and focus on business outcomes

Job title: Business Analyst - Mandarin speaker - up to $65K
Job description:
Protiviti is a global consulting firm that delivers deep expertise, objective insights, a tailored approach and unparalleled collaboration to help leaders confidently face the future. Through our network of more than 70 offices in over 20 countries, Protiviti and its independently owned Member Firms provide clients with consulting solutions in finance, technology, operations, data, analytics, business performance improvement, risk and internal audit.

Protiviti are looking for skilled candidates for the following role:

The Company

The client is an international corporation with an excellent reputation both here in Asia and also globally.

The Role

As an Insurance business analyst you will engage in the following:

Defines and documents customer business functions and processes;

Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access;

Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users;

Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training;

Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of existing/ new system functionality;

Support product launches and production activities from system perspective;

Work closely with IT team to resolve system issues at expected service level;

Assist in data extraction and reporting activities;

Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information systems and/or non-system driver changes; assists in the preparation of proposals to develop new systems and/or operational changes; and

Plans, organizes and conducts business process reengineering/improvement projectsand/or management reviews.

Your Profile

To qualify as a business analyst for this role, you MUST have:

University graduate preferably in Business, Finance, IT or other related disciplines

Minimum 7 years experience as a business analyst within financial services

Good understanding of operational and technical needs of the insurance business

Strong BA skills a must (user requirement, process analysis and documentation, defining of the solution, UAT etc.)

Life or health insurance experience is preferred

English and Mandarin fluency a must

Immediately available highly preferred and will be considered first

Apply Today

To apply online (Word attachment only), please click the Apply Now button. Please note that only short-listed candidates will be contacted.

About Protiviti

Protiviti is a global consulting firm that delivers deep expertise, objective insights, a tailored approach and unparalleled collaboration to help leaders confidently face the future. Through our network of more than 70 offices in over 20 countries, Protiviti and its independently owned Member Firms provide clients with consulting solutions in finance, technology, operations, data, analytics, business performance improvement, risk and internal audit. As a Protiviti consultant, you will not only work on interesting business issues with world-class companies, but you will also have access to training and networking opportunities to accelerate your expertise.

Contract Type: Permanent

Location: Hong Kong

Specialisation:
Banking & Financial Services
IT & Telecoms
Finance Technology

Contact Details: Marcel Gundlach

Contact Email: Marcel.Gundlach@jac-recruitment.com

Published: 7 days ago

Overview
The CLIENT
Our client provides a full spectrum of corporate banking services to their customers including syndication loans, treasury, transaction banking, financial advisory, project finance, merger and acquisition, leveraged finance, structured finance, etc.
THE JOB ROLE
The Systems Planning & Development Section (SPD) is responsible for overall system planning of Hong Kong office, EUC/RPA development, PoC for new system solutions, and security control. System Security Control Team is mainly responsible for conducting user ID and access authority control, system security monitoring, software license control, database management, firewall management, penetration test and follow up, coordinate assessment for regulatory requirement, support Head office and local system projects and follow up the revision of system security policy, guideline and let related staff to understand them.
We are looking for an individual who sets challenging individual or Team targets to contributes to our customer, organization, and section and has strong motivation to achieve the targets.
Enhance internal and external network and acquires knowledge for executing deals and tasks; nurtures the performance and potential of juniors by providing regular feedback/guidance.
Responsibilities
Perform assigned tasks in a correct and timely manner
Always observe compliance of policies and procedures
Monitor and make recommendations for process improvement
Provide covers all activities related to System Security Control team members
To assume a team lead position to manage all-round Cybersecurity function for the Bank
To identify potential threats of and report on security violations and control weaknesses in Cybersecurity by determining causes, possible solutions and remedial actions required for ensuring data security.
To recommend and implement changes to procedures and systems designed to enhance systems security.
To develop and conduct IT security awareness training programs for all units within the Bank and ensure IT security/risk compliance within the bank.
To develop and maintain the system security procedures to cope with policy and standard established by H.O., and to follow up the revision of System Security Policies and Guidelines.
Design, develop and update IT risk management framework, policies and controls taking into consideration the bank’s strategy, current/future regulatory requirements, and emerging risk scenarios. Communicate IT risk management standards, policies, and procedures to stakeholders of the bank.
Assess the potential cybersecurity impact of emerging technologies and innovations, and include known risk and issues.
To delegate the assignments and supervise subordinates in overall daily security control operations of all systems.
Requirements
Bachelor Degree in computer science or IT;
Minimum 5 years related experience in Cybersecurity;
Supervisory experience is essential;
Familiar with Windows Serve installation and security administration, Windows Active Directory, Domain Group Policy, DBMS administration (MSSQL, Oracle, etc), networking device and firewall configuration and administration and practical experience for those setting and monitoring.
Proficiency in English and Cantonese.
Holding professional level qualification that is specified in HKMA Enhanced Competency Framework on Cybersecurity (ECF-C)

COMPENSATION/BENEFITS
Competitive basic monthly salary + Performance Bonus
Full-time, Permanent, HK-based role
Medical, Dental & Life Insurance
5-day week

APPLICATION
Interested candidates are welcome to send their latest CV/resume, preferably including:
Current and expected salary
Availability
Reason for leaving current and past positions

Channel Operations Analyst

Who are we?

As the worlds largest data center company, Equinix brings global leaders the power of interconnection: the ability to connect in many ways to the many customers, partners and geographies they need to accelerate business performance and craft new opportunities. Equinix is a platform for innovation, growth and leadership.?

We facilitate more than 380,000 connections among our 9,000+ customers, making us the leading global interconnection platform. We are passionate about further evolving the specific areas of software development, software and network architecture, network operations, and complex cloud and application solutions.?

The Role

This role will support the Channel Program from the sales operations side and manage the opportunity registration, pipeline measurement, support of sales compensation for Channel deals and reporting.

Responsibilities

Manage offshore support on the registration of partners and channel sales opportunities and handle first level of escalation.

Data management of channel opportunity records in SFDC, including auditing and resolving data integrity issues.

Manage the linking and de-duplication of SFDC opportunities to ensure only one rolled-up deal value per eventual closed deal.

SFDC Report and dashboard development for sales team and for data integrity checks

Computational Biologist (in the grade/rank of Senior Research Assistant / Senior Technical Officer) (several posts) in the Centre for PanorOmic Sciences (Ref.: 499994) (to commence as soon as possible, on a two-year fixed-term basis with contract-end gratuity and University contribution to a retirement benefits scheme, totalling up to 10% of basic salary, with the possibility of renewal subject to satisfactory performance)

We are seeking for talented computational scientists with backgrounds in mass spectrometry, metabolomics, proteomics or informatics, to join our bioinformatics team.

Applicants should have a Ph.D. degree in Computer Science, Bioinformatics, Biological Sciences, or a related discipline, with at least 3 years’ hands-on bioinformatics analysis experience; and possess the ability to use programming languages such as R, Python, Perl, Java, or related languages. Applicants with less experience/qualifications but with a good initiative will also be considered.

The appointees will have the unique opportunity to participate in world-class research, work with clinicians, biologists and bioinformatics experts, and expose to a wide range of applications. They will apply the latest analytics tools to multi-omics data, evaluate and establish analysis pipelines, lead and provide supervision of junior staff members. Those who have responded to the previous advertisement (Ref.: 499734) need not re-apply.

A highly competitive salary commensurate with qualifications and experience will be offered, in addition to annual leave and medical benefits.

POSITION SUMMARY
The Manager is responsible for overall control, management, and accountability of Corporate Regional’s entire payroll and related administration function, in accordance with relevant policies, procedures, and legislation.
KEY ROLES & RESPONSIBILITIES
Manage and ensure accuracy and timely administration, preparing and processing of all payrolls, and related data and information, and related tax filings in accordance with relevant policies, procedures and legislation, including but not limit to Hong Kong, Cyprus, US and Philippines, and manage the related reporting information needed for our financial statement and regulatory disclosures and filings.
Maintain, revise and develop policies and procedures relating to payroll administration, consistent with relevant legislation, regulations and company policy.
Develop and ensure adherence to critical time lines for all regulatory and reporting requirements and perform monthly or ad hoc reporting for management purposes.
Manage payroll team, including formulating and evaluating individual employee key performance objectives and individual professional development. Manage, coach and develop the Payroll team and ensure achievement of departmental key performance objectives.
Maintain all payroll computations and records. Liaise and work closely with various internal departments and external parties, e.g. external auditors, etc, for complying with relevant disclosures and regulatory and statutory obligations, filings and reporting.
Prepare payroll and related information for financial reporting disclosure and ensure the compliance of relevant accounting standards and disclosure in different statutory, regulatory and financial reporting requirements.
Ensure the upload of General Ledger interface files after each pay process for the correct and timely allocation of costs to the business units. Also assist business analysts with payroll related costs queries, including reallocation by journal where required.
Keep abreast of labour law, tax changes and regulations. Responsible to advise, response and resolve internal payroll queries.
Process Corporate Regional staff's annual salary review, including back-pay calculations and payment. Ensure a thorough audit process is undertaken, verifying the accuracy of all information. Manage the recovery of payroll over-payments, including process improvement to reduce the number of over-payments made and the length of time taken to recover funds.
Prepare year end/monthly/ad hoc reconciliations. These reconciliations include but not limited to the following items:
Payroll clearing account on a monthly basis
Payroll tax reconciliation on quarterly and yearly basis for different tax jurisdictions
Year-end reconciliation between general ledger and employee Payment Summaries.
Co-ordinate and prepare required employee compensation documentation, e.g. income proof, etc.
Adhere to and comply with SOX requirements in accordance to the Company’s policy and standard.
Involve in ad hoc payroll related project and handle ad hoc requests on payroll and related payroll and tax information.
REQUIREMENTS & QUALIFICATIONS
The candidate should have the following qualifications and attributes:
A bachelor degree in accounting, finance or other related field is required, with an internationally recognized accounting qualification. At least 8-10 years of experience in payroll management or financial responsibility with regional payroll experience. Big 4 training is preferred. Deal with sensitive matters professionally High level of technical accounting, financial reporting and analytical skills in a multi-business unit environment. A self-starter with a high level of motivation and commitment. Ability to utilize appropriate operating systems and software applications to access data and generate reports

Job title: Chief Corporate Development Officer / Chief Technology Officer
Company: Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation
Job description:
About the Corporation
Hong Kong Science and Technology Park (HKSTP) is in the fore-front of driving Innovation, Technology and Entrepreneurship of Hong Kong. Currently, the Science Park houses 800+ companies with a 13,000+ workforce, majority of which are Research and Development Professionals. We run an Incubation program to help Technology Start-up realise their dreams. We are also responsible for connecting venture investors with park companies and beyond, especially in early stages. Indeed, we are a venture capitalist ourselves with over $600M fund. In addition to building the Ecosystem for Technology, Innovation and Entrepreneurship, HKSTP is also responsible for the management and development of Industrial Estates (Taipo, Yuen Long and Tseung Kwan O) which host over 130 industrialists in various industries.
The Science Park at Shatin (and also Innocenter at Kowloon Tong) is the concentration of R&D and Start-up in HK. Our purpose is to enable successes of our Partner companies through establishing and growing a vibrant Innovation and Technology centric ecosystem, encouraging Entrepreneurship, providing various needed platform and services, which we believe is the future of Hong Kong. Our job is not just to Connect, Collaborate and Catalyze, but make things happen.
Objectives and Responsibilities:-
The CCDO/CTO is one of the top Strategic Leaders at HKSTP whose role is basically “Value Creation” for all partner companies. The incumbent, a key partner to the CEO, is part of the core leadership team of HKSTP, building the future of Hong Kong. He/She has to be technology savvy, with strong management experience in managing sizable organization, preferably including Product/Technology Management, People Development, Business and Commercial Operation, Investment related Development (Fund or M&A), and Manufacturing/Industrial Operations.
The role requires strong leadership with a passion for the future of Hong Kong, with Technology and Innovation being the major focus.
VALUE CREATION : create values for all partner companies of HKSTP, through technology.
STRATEGIC DIRECTION AND EXECUTION : set and execute strategic and operational goals for HKSTP, the team to enable partner companies successes and establish, sustain and accelerate HK/HKSTP’s Innovation and Technology leadership position.
A PROVEN BUSINESS LEADER : provide leadership to a diverse team of subject matter experts.
Technology
ICT, Bio-Medical, Green Technology, Material & Precision Engineering, Electronics
800+ companies in Science Park, and 150+ Industrial Estates grantees
The CCDO/CTO is responsible for creating an ecosystem and enabling their successes – manage accounts, design and rollout needed programs and policies, provide needed services and platforms to address needs.
Elevate the adoption and commercialization of technology for our partner companies
Application of technology in the smart campus at Science Park

Incubation
The Incubation program consists of various stages and themes. From pre-incubation to acceleration, there are, at any one time, over 400 companies being incubated.
The CCDO/CTO will overlook the expert team in running and enhancing the programs and related policies, with goals to drive both quantity and quality of startups in programs, and position HK/HKSTP as the startup hub in the region.
Like any technologies, Incubation programs evolve over time. We expect continuous improvements with new ideas.

Partnership
Set strategy and plan, develop various partnership segmentation and programs, drive technology adoption
Technology adoption is key to the success of our partner companies. It is critical to engage industrial partners. In addition to helping the SMEs of HKSTP develop their applications, such partnership is critical in elevating technology awareness of Hong Kong traditional Industries. Technology itself is not an industry. This team is responsible for bringing technologies to all industries and ultimately elevate HK as the Technology Solution Hub.
Co-incubation and co-creation, working across companies in Science Park and in the society. Mutual benefits.

Leasing and Operation Services
Oversee the leasing matters including lease execution, and setting the right level of pricing, balancing support to SME and financial prudency with Finance.
Manage a centralized operational team to support various funding programs to ensure efficiency, effectiveness and quality

Investment
Investors should be here looking for opportunities all the time.
Sell side: this team is responsible for bringing investors (of various types: Angel, VC, Family Offices, Individuals etc.) to talk to HKSTP companies. This team is the I-bank representatives of all the 800+ companies of HKSTP.
Buy side: we run a CVF (Corporate Venture Fund) of over $600M fund. This CVF invests in companies in HKSTP.
The CCDO/CTO is to manage the team, assess and refine objectives of both buy and sell sides to meet / lead the investment landscape/trends, ultimately driving deal flows, successes of partner companies and position HK as the investment hub in I&T in the region.

Industrial Estates
The three Industrial Estates (Taipo, Yuen Long, Tseung Kwan O) are valuable resources of Hong Kong. There are over 130 grantees (industrialists).
The development of IE is based on Technology Products, Advanced Manufacturing, Local consumption, High Tech employment, R&D Contents, Output and Investment.
Help current industrialists Transform and Upgrade (升級轉型)
Bring in new grantees of Industrial Estates to help economies of HK through technology and Industrialization
Develop needed framework, policies, guidelines to enable goals of IE
Drive a closer ecosystem between Science Park and Industrial Estates

Requirements:-
University or post-graduate degree in Technology preferably with Management education
Over 20 years' relevant experience in Product or Technology Management at a senior executive level with technology based organization
Deep experience in at least two of the major technology areas is highly desirable (Biomedical, ICT, Electronics, Green Technology, Materials & Precision Engineering)
Have good understanding of technology business and is able to communicate effectively with stakeholders at various levels
Have a passion for technology and innovation. Not a Scientist, but a Tech-Lover
Strong business acumen with demonstrated experiences in bringing innovation and technology to real industry uses
Experience in dealing with Properties, Development and Government Organization would be added advantage
Experience in equity investment an advantage
Experience in advanced manufacturing an advantage
Strong communication skills with excellent command of spoken/written English and Chinese (Cantonese & Mandarin)
Team player, able to work with and help peers, and deal with ambiguity
Able to present to Board and Committees, with presentation and paper-writing skills
This is the most senior position of HKSTP reporting into the CEO. Only those with proven leadership experience will be considered.

[This position is open for referral by Recruitment agencies. The profile should be sent to our HR email address agencycv@hkstp.org]
We offer market competitive compensation, 5-day work week and generous benefits including medical and life insurance. To apply, please send your full resume with current and expected salary to the Human Resources & Office Administration Department, Hong Kong Science and Technology Parks Corporation, 5/F, Building 5E, 5 Science Park East Avenue, Hong Kong Science Park, Hong Kong or, by email to hr@hkstp.org on or before 27 April 2020. Please quote the reference number on the email subject/envelope and the application letter.
Personal data provided will be treated in strict confidence and used for recruitment purpose only. All personal data collected will be used strictly in accordance with employer’s personal data policies, you can access to HKSTP’s Personal Information Collection Statement at https://www.hkstp.org/hkstp_web/en/hkstp/personal-information-collection-statement-recruitment
Applicants not invited for interview within four weeks after application deadline may consider their applications unsuccessful. Personal data of unsuccessful applicants will be retained for a maximum of two years.
www.hkstp.org

Ever since our beginning in 1942, Emperor Group has grown and expanded into a diversified group of businesses that include financial services, property, watch and jewellery, entertainment, hospitality, media, furniture and furnishing, eSports, as well as co-working space. Six companies within the Group are listed on the Main Board of The Stock Exchange of Hong Kong. These include Emperor International Holdings Limited (Stock code: 163), which focuses on real estate investment and property development; Emperor Watch and Jewellery Limited (Stock code: 887), which specializes in the retail of luxury watches and fine jewellery; Emperor Entertainment Hotel Limited (Stock code: 296), which concentrates on hotel, gaming and catering businesses in Macau; Emperor Capital Group Limited (Stock code: 717), which provides a wide range of financial services; and Emperor Culture Group Limited (Stock code: 491), which principally engages in entertainment, media and cultural development business; and Ulferts International Limited (Stock code: 1711), which is engaged in chain retailing of upmarket European furniture. Emperor Foundation and Albert Yeung Sau Shing Charity Foundation were set up to fulfill our corporate social responsibility. We care for our staff, customers, partners, the public, and the environment, all with a view to sustainable growth together with all our stakeholders. Manage and monitor various projects and able to deliver agreed solution on time

Liaise with vendors for requirement, quotation, contracts and implementation

Minimum of 5 years relevant experience as IT business analyst

Strong in collecting user requirement, analyses, and transform to prototypes for development

Proven track record for managing vendor along the whole SDLC.

SQL skillset is preferred for troubleshooting / data extracts

Strong interpersonal skills and a good team player

Excellent communication skills in English and Cantonese, Mandarin is a plus

We offer 5-day-work week with competitive remuneration benefit packages to the right candidate. Interested parties please send your application letter, resume, expected salary availability to Human Resources Department, 28/F, Emperor Group Centre, 288 Hennessy Road, Wan Chai, Hong Kong or by fax 2835-6677 or by clicking the "Apply Now" button below.

We are an equal opportunity employer welcome applications from all qualified candidates. The information provided will be treated in strict confidence be used only for consideration of your application for relevant / similar posts within the Emperor Group. ClusterTech Limited is committed to providing value to clients through advanced computing technologies including Cloud, High Performance Computing, AI Analytics and Big Data. We provide a comprehensive range of services and products to solve problems in massive data processing, large-scale computing, in-depth analysis, artificial intelligence, and uninterrupted service. Our business areas include financial engineering (investment analysis, risk management, derivatives pricing, etc.), business intelligence (sales forecasting, customer management, inventory management, etc.), environmental science (weather forecast, heavy rain and turbulence forecasting, analysis and prediction of pollution, etc.), smart city (information gathering, information analysis, optimisation and management), and internet applications (massive image processing, video storage and delivery). We also provide public cloud, private cloud and hybrid cloud solutions for businesses of all sizes.

KaiOS Technologies powers an ecosystem of affordable digital products and services, and exists to empower people around the world through technology. Its flagship product, KaiOS, is the leading mobile operating system for smart feature phones with more than 120 million devices shipped in over 100 countries. Kais mission is to open up new possibilities for individuals, organizations, and societies by bringing mobile connectivity to the billions of people without internet in emerging markets, as well as providing those in established markets with an alternative to smartphones. KaiOS is based on HTML5 and other open web technologies. Devices running on the platform require limited memory, while still offering a rich user experience through access to apps like the Google Assistant, WhatsApp, YouTube, Facebook, and Google Maps.

KaiOS is a Mobile Operating System for Smart Feature Phones that stormed the scene to become the 3rd largest mobile OS globally (2nd in India ahead of iOS). We are on 100M+ devices in 100+ countries. We recently closed a Series B round with Cathay Innovation, Google and TCL.

We are looking for a Project Manager for our Hong Kong-based data team to work alongside Data Engineers, Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Machine Learning Engineers and DevOps Engineers. The Data team at KaiOS is in charge of everything that is driven by the vast and varied datasets produced by our platform and ecosystem - insight / analytics, data APIs and machine learning models and at-scale data systems to support it all.

Broad classes of things the team works on:
Data feeds, reports, dashboards, metrics KPIs for varied internal and external constituencies

Distillation of high-grade datasets that enable data science and machine learning

Development, productization and refinement of machine learning models

APIs powered by this data and models

Initiatives to support data quality and completeness

Your core activities would be:
Unpacking underlying value in data-related requests originating from various constituencies, prioritizing and breaking down the work

Maintaining the team backlog and ensuring end-to-end delivery

Working tirelessly to remove obstacles in the teams path

Coordinating with other teams across KaiOS

What we are looking for:
Engineering background and Academic Qualifications

Outstanding analytical thinking, organizational skills and attention to detail to understand designs, dependencies, challenges and risks in order to ensure timely and reliable delivery

Extensive experience in data-centric environments

Experience working in cross-functional delivery-focused agile teams

Experience with iterative development across multiple work streams

At least 5 years of experience in dealing with data driven products

Excellent written and verbal communication skills

We offer attractive salary and fringe benefit. Interested parties please apply with your full resume stating present and expected salary to Human Resources Manager via email by clicking "Apply Now".

For more information, please visit our website at www.kaiostech.com/

KaiOS Technologies powers an ecosystem of affordable digital products and services, and exists to empower people around the world through technology. Its flagship product, KaiOS, is the leading mobile operating system for smart feature phones with more than 120 million devices shipped in over 100 countries. Kais mission is to open up new possibilities for individuals, organizations, and societies by bringing mobile connectivity to the billions of people without internet in emerging markets, as well as providing those in established markets with an alternative to smartphones. KaiOS is based on HTML5 and other open web technologies. Devices running on the platform require limited memory, while still offering a rich user experience through access to apps like the Google Assistant, WhatsApp, YouTube, Facebook, and Google Maps.

KaiOS is a mobile operating system for smart feature phones that stormed the scene to become the 3rd largest mobile OS globally (2nd in India ahead of iOS). We are on 100M+ devices in 100+ countries. We recently closed a Series B round with Cathay Innovation, Google and TCL.

We are looking for an experienced big data engineer for our Hong Kong-based data technology team to work as part of an agile team alongside data scientists, data analysts, software and DevOps engineers. The team is in charge of all data products and data infrastructure at KaiOS. Much of our data is event-based from a variety of rich data streams, such as Kai app store and our own real-time advertising tech stack (built by another Hong Kong-based team under the same roof). We strive to distill the data trail from millions of users interactions with our platform into a progressively enhanced and robust analytical picture in the key areas of business. We also build and operate data and machine learning-powered APIs.

What we are looking for:
Breadth and depth of knowledge and experience with data technology at scale

Extensive experience with a variety of databases, including modern non-relational data technology and understanding of underlying design choices, trade-offs, sweet spots and internal workings

Experience building scalable and reliabledata pipelines

Knowledge of data formats and associated tradeoffs

Experience with streaming data processing a plus

Extensive experience with test automation, CI / CD

Extensive experience with modern version control systems, such as Git

Experience designing and developing REST or GraphQL APIs a plus

Experience working in cross-functional delivery-focused agile teams

Extensive experience with iterative development

Outstanding analytical thinking, problem solving skills and attention to detail

Excellent verbal and written communication skills

Requirements:
Engineering background and academic qualifications

Fluency in Python or Scala; shell scripting; Golang a plus

In-depth knowledge and fluency with SQL

Experience with data modeling

Extensive experience with AWS, including services such as EMR/Spark, Kinesis, RedShift, RDS, DynamoDB, Athena, Glue, Lambda, CloudWatch, IAM, etc. Infrastructure tooling and automation a plus.

KaiOS Technologies powers an ecosystem of affordable digital products and services, and exists to empower people around the world through technology. Its flagship product, KaiOS, is the leading mobile operating system for smart feature phones with more than 100 million devices shipped in over 100 countries. KaiOS is based on HTML5 and other open web technologies. Devices running on the platform require limited memory, while still offering a rich user experience through access to apps like the Google Assistant, YouTube, Facebook, Google Maps, and Twitter.

Kais mission is to open up new possibilities for individuals, organizations, and society by bringing mobile connectivity to the billions of people without internet in emerging markets, as well as providing those in established markets with an alternative to smartphones. To make this happen, Kai partners with leading ODM/OEMs and carriers, such as ATT, Sprint, T-Mobile, Orange, MTN, China Mobile, HMD, Doro, and Bullitt. Kai is also backed by major technology and telecom industry players, including Google, Reliance Jio and TCL. Together with these partners, Kai focuses on creating affordable devices and data plans that make internet access a reality for everyone, while simultaneously helping partners transform their business models.

Now were looking curious and analytical data scientists to help us tackle some of our most challenging and meaningful tasks.

As a Data Scientist at KaiOS youll be working with a team of world-class engineers and analysts to gain insight, optimize systems, and drive revenue. Your responsibilities will include designing, producing and improving ML AI systems that will optimize some of the most crucial aspects of KaiOS monetization strategy.

How do we optimize our advertising revenue? How should the recommendation engine in our app store work? What can we learn and deduce about our user base? What on earth does that weird spike on the graph mean?! Do our business forecasts make sense? These and many other challenges will be part of your day to day activities at KaiOS.

As part of the KaiOS Monetization team, the overarching goal of our activities will be to find ways to necessary to allow us to reach our goal of bridging the digital divide without sacrificing user experience.

If youre a passionate and driven data scientist with experience working in Tech we definitely want to hear from you. Previous experience from eCommerce, mobile apps/gaming or other similar fields is a strong plus.

Apart from being a wizard with algorithms and analysis, we also expect you to be technically literate enough to participate in high-level technical discussions with our engineers, and to be able to work independently.

We would like to see that you have experience with:
Degree in Mathematics, Computer Science, BI Data, preferably in Statistics

At least 5 years relevant experience in Commerce, mobile apps/gaming or other similar fields.

Statistical and data mining techniques like GLM/Regression, Random Forest, Boosting, Trees etc.

Statistical/data languages: R, Python, SQL etc.
Web services: Redshift, S3, Athena etc.
Creating and using advanced machine learning algorithms: simulation, clustering, neural networks, etc.
Data/database tools: Excel, MySQL/PostgreSQL etc.
Data visualization presentation for stakeholders using: PowerBI, tableau etc.

If you think you fit the bill, we cant wait to hear from you. Contact us to today and join us on the journey of connecting the next billion people to the internet!

Who we are:

Global Shares is a leading provider of public and private global stock plan services. Our employee share ownership plan technology is award-winning, and our range of products and services make equity plan administration simple, secure, and globally compliant.

What we value:

People -We care about our people. We treat our people with respect. We embrace diversity and inclusion. We build open and honest relationships, collaborating across boundaries to meet our clients’ needs.

Bravery -We dare to do things diﬀerently. We provide best service and technology through innovation, creativity and high performance. We challenge the norm, we challenge ourselves and we challenge complexity with simplicity.

Global -We are one global network. We are champions of employee ownership. We work together, incorporating clients and partners as an extension of our team. We foster a global and diverse community, where our people are united through ambition, commitment and shared goals. We are in this journey together.

Integrity-We are committed to professional integrity We conduct our business to the highest standards with skill, diligence and responsibility. Professional trust, honesty and compliance are at the core of our culture

Service-We are client focused. We strive to provide our best service, to drive great client experience through teamwork and high performance.

Why we need you:

Following the implementation process our clients are handed over to our Operations Team to help support them on their Global Shares journey. Being an Operations Analyst is an exciting and challenging role where no two days are the same! You will become an expert in Share Plan Administration, which will open up a world of career opportunities to you. You’ll work with a fantastic team and have the opportunity to engage with people globally on a daily basis. We are looking for experienced confident individuals to join the team to support our clients.

Managing a portfolio of Companies administering employee share plans within a team framework
Interact with customers/clients on operational transactions related to their share plan program.
Execute the timely processing of operational transactions, including data management, reconciliation, processing, reporting and problem solving.
Organize, develop and maintain procedural and process documentation related to client companies’ program(s) to ensure accurate transaction processing and minimize risk.
Assist in identifying new system tools and enhancements to existing systems.
Implement projects to enhance business operations.
Act as a point of contact for Client Accounts.
Create and maintain excellent relations with key business partners.

What you have:

Experience in Share Plan or similar industry desirable but not required
University Degree in Business/Finance or equivalent experience preferred
Excellent communication skills
Excellent command of written and spoken English,Cantonese and Mandarin
Proven numeric, financial analysis, documentation and procedural skills required
Excellent computer skills including Microsoft Excel and Word
Demonstrate commercial acumen with an ability to be innovative & pro-active
Ability to prioritise and adhere to tight deadlines

What we offer:

Opportunity to be part of something special, Global Shares is growing fast, and we want you to be part of our journey
Competitive salary
Health Insurance
Pension / MPF
Employee Assistance Programme
Flexible working

What our Interview Process is like:

Step 1- After you apply, a recruiter may reach out to you for an introductory call
Step 2- If your background is a match for the role, you may be required to complete a technical assessment (role depended) and/or phone interview with 1-2 people
Step 3- If you continue through the process, you will come onsite 1-2 times to interview

Job title: Insurance Business Analyst-upto 65K 12 months rolling contract
Job description:
Protiviti is a global consulting firm that delivers deep expertise, objective insights, a tailored approach and unparalleled collaboration to help leaders confidently face the future. Through our network of more than 70 offices in over 20 countries, Protiviti and its independently owned Member Firms provide clients with consulting solutions in finance, technology, operations, data, analytics, business performance improvement, risk and internal audit.

Protiviti are looking for skilled candidates for the following role:

The Company

Our client is one of the largest global banks in the world and offers a wide range of financial services from investment banking, retail banking, commercial banking and many more. They are currently investing heavily into digital banking and are looking to lead regional digital programme on public websites for 12 countries in APAC, initially on a 12 months rolling contract.

The Role

As an Insurance business analyst you will engage in the following:

Defines and documents customer business functions and processes;

Consults with functional unit management and personnel to identify, define and document business needs and objectives, current operational procedures, problems, input and output requirements, and levels of systems access;

Analyzes the feasibility of, and develops requirements for systems and enhancements to existing systems; ensures the system design fits the needs of the users;

Tracks and fully documents changes for functional and business specifications; writes detailed universally understood procedures for permanent records and for use in training;

Participates in user acceptance testing and testing of existing/ new system functionality;

Support product launches and production activities from system perspective;

Work closely with IT team to resolve system issues at expected service level;

Assist in data extraction and reporting activities;

Identifies opportunities for improving business processes through information

Your profile

To qualify as a business analyst for this role, you MUST have:

University graduate preferably in Business, Finance, IT or other related disciplines

Minimum 3 years experience as a business analyst within financial services

Good understanding of operational and technical needs of the insurance business

Strong BA skills a must (user requirement, process analysis and documentation, defining of the solution, UAT etc.)

Life or health insurance experience is preferred

English and Cantonese fluency a must

Immediately available highly preferred and will be considered first

Apply Today

Job title: Sales & Research Technology - Business Analyst, Associate
Job description:
As a member of our Business Analysis team, you'll play a crucial role in identifying, improving and developing technology solutions that drive our strategic goals. This is a tremendous opportunity to learn about high-priority initiatives and collaborate with colleagues throughout the firm. Working at the intersection of business and technology, you'll sharpen your understanding of business processes and data analysis, while continuing to develop your leadership, management and communication skills. No matter where your career ultimately takes you, you'll make a meaningful impact and lasting connections with outstanding colleagues and mentors.
Working in the Research Publishing & Distribution team, you will play a role in driving the transformation of our publishing platform, web-based portals and data APIs. From rich UIs to low-level backend services and database integrations, we are looking for a true problem solver who relishes new challenges, is not afraid to fail and seeks to deliver world-class user experiences.
We are a fast-paced, high-energy, diversified team based in London, Glasgow, NY, Mumbai, Bangalore and Hong Kong. Innovation, experimentation and continual improvement are core parts of our culture as we design, build and test high quality software using Agile practices. We believe strongly in the value of diverse representation and you’ll get to experience this on a day-to-day basis working with colleagues across time zones, teams and backgrounds to solve complex problems for our clients. Every day is different and we strive to create a supportive environment where you’ll be able to grow and develop your skills as a technologist to maximize your potential.

This role requires a wide variety of strengths and capabilities, including:

BS/BA degree or equivalent experience
A strong understanding of at least one business function in the firm, as well as a broader understanding of other areas.
Proficiency in business applications, data usage and management
Ability to liaison between lines of business and the development team, while working with a wide range of stakeholders and collaborating with your team.
Ability to work collaboratively in teams and develop meaningful relationships to achieve common goals

J.P. Morgan Global Research provides strategies and analysis to clients across markets and asset classes. J.P. Morgan is consistently named a Top Global Research Firm by Institutional Investor.
Our Corporate & Investment Bank relies on innovators like you to build and maintain the technology that helps us safely service the world’s important corporations, governments and institutions. You’ll develop solutions for a bank entrusted with holding $18 trillion of assets and $393 billion in deposits. The Corporate & Investment Bank provides strategic advice, raises capital, manages risk, and extends liquidity in markets spanning over 100 countries around the world.

When you work at JPMorgan Chase & Co., you’re not just working at a global financial institution. You’re an integral part of one of the world’s biggest tech companies. In 15 technology centers worldwide, our team of 50,000 technologists design, build and deploy everything from enterprise technology initiatives to big data and mobile solutions, as well as innovations in electronic payments, cybersecurity, machine learning, and cloud development. Our $11B annual investment in technology enables us to hire people to create innovative solutions that are transforming the financial services industry.


At JPMorgan Chase & Co. we value the unique skills of every employee, and we’re building a technology organization that thrives on diversity. We encourage professional growth and career development, and offer competitive benefits and compensation. If you’re looking to build your career as part of a global technology team tackling big challenges that impact the lives of people and companies all around the world, we want to meet you.


Ready to use your expertise and experience to drive change? Apply today.
